DataElement.preferredName: IES 14 Past Seven Days How Frequently True Reminder Brought Back Feelings of Event Score 4 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation, in the past seven days, of how frequently true it was that any reminder brought back feelings about the event, using a 4 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Impact of Events Scale Past Week How Frequently True Reminder Brought Back Feelings of Event Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A set of 15 questions designed to measure the amount of distress a person associates with a specific event by assessing the frequency with which they experience intrusive thoughts and avoidant behaviors._The most recent week. May include the present day._A question asking an individual how frequently something was true for them._A question about whether any reminder brought back feelings about the event for an individual._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A set of 15 questions designed to measure the amount of distress a person associates with a specific event by assessing the frequency with which they experience intrusive thoughts and avoidant behaviors.

Concepts.definition: A set of 15 questions designed to measure the amount of distress a person associates with a specific event by assessing the frequency with which they experience intrusive thoughts and avoidant behaviors.

Property.preferredName: Past Week How Frequently True Reminder Brought Back Feelings of Event Score

May include the present day.:A question asking an individual how frequently something was true for them.:A question about whether any reminder brought back feelings about the event for an individual.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: The most recent week. May include the present day.
A question asking an individual how frequently something was true for them.

Concepts.longName: Reminder Brought Back Feelings of Event
Concepts.definition: A question about whether any reminder brought back feelings about the event for an individual.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredName: Breast-Impact of Treatment Frequency 4 Point Scale

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer that something occurs frequently.

Concepts.definition: On many occasions, or in many situations.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: From time to time, but not continually or always.

Concepts.definition: From time to time, but not continually or always.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Added "Sometimes" to represent the MSAS value domain.ghd.01.27.15

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of no agreement or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Any reminder brought back fee
ReferenceDocuments.description: Any reminder brought back feelings about it.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.

DataElement.origin: IES:Impact of Event Scale; M. Horowitz et al., Impact of Event Scale: A measure of subjective stress. 1979, Psychosomatic Med 41, 209-218
